children.definition: Whether the parent holding company provides a guarantee. Standard in PC market. May be limited to equity value of the borrower. Present in 100% of DealData deals.
children.name: Holdings Guarantee

children.definition: All direct and indirect wholly-owned U.S. subsidiaries must guarantee. Bank preferred position per DLS Row 66. Material restricted subsidiaries in BSL.
children.name: Domestic Subsidiary Requirement

children.definition: Obligation for parent entities to cause downstream subsidiaries to provide guarantees and pledge collateral for the credit facility. Addresses structural subordination risk by requiring that value held at lower-tier subsidiaries supports the credit. Scope limited by fraudulent conveyance savings clauses and local law restrictions in non-US jurisdictions.
children.name: Down-Streaming Requirement
Upstream Guarantee Limitation
children.definition: Guarantee direction scope includes down-streaming requirement and upstream guarantee limitations.

Direction of guarantee flow: upstream (sub guarantees parent), downstream (parent guarantees sub), cross-stream (sister entities cross-guarantee). Upstream guarantees subject to fraudulent transfer risk.

market_benchmarks.prevalence_of_holdco_debt_service_permis: [cat4.5] KCT cat4.5 requires prevalence/severity data for 'prevalence of holdco debt service permissions' but no existing node provides this benchmark.
market_benchmarks.sponsor_management_fee_ranges: [cat4.5] KCT cat4.5 requires prevalence/severity data for 'sponsor/management fee ranges' but no existing node provides this benchmark.
market_benchmarks.typical_holdco_expense_caps: [cat4.5] KCT cat4.5 requires prevalence/severity data for 'typical holdco expense caps' but no existing node provides this benchmark.

children.name: Upstream / Downstream / Cross-Stream

children.definition: Each guarantor liable for the full guaranteed amount, not just its proportional share. Standard in leveraged finance. Lenders can pursue any single guarantor for full recovery.
children.name: Joint and Several Liability

children.definition: Financial test for 'material' subsidiary designation: 2.5% of consolidated total assets (individual, 81.1% use), 2.5% revenue, 2.5% EBITDA. 5% aggregate cap.
children.name: Material Subsidiary Threshold

children.definition: Reduces guaranteed amount to the maximum that can be guaranteed without constituting a fraudulent transfer under applicable law. Limits upstream guarantee to net assets of guarantor.
children.name: Guarantee Limitation / Savings Clause

children.definition: Defines which entities in the corporate structure provide credit support (guarantees) to the facility. Scope determines lender claim breadth across the corporate group and recovery breadth in default.

extraction_refs.difficulty_note: Aligned from ontology=medium vs playbook=very_hard (playbook authority for extraction complexity)

GUAR_SCOPE.label: Guarantors - Scope
exactPhrases: Note any unusual aspects of collateral/guaranty structure
all existing and future direct and indirect domestic subsidiaries
Note any unusual aspects of collateral/guaranty structure
all existing and future direct and indirect domestic subsidiaries

market_benchmarks.bank_preferred: Holdings + all direct/indirect wholly-owned U.S. subs

children.name: Guarantee Scope

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Guarantees limited to material subsidiaries only; excluded subsidiaries for immaterial subs; foreign subsidiaries excluded entirely
key_negotiation_axes: scope: all domestic vs material only
excluded_subsidiary_threshold: none vs revenue_based vs asset_based
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: All domestic subsidiaries (existing and future) guarantee on joint & several basis; Holdings guarantee; pledge 100% domestic equity, 65% first-tier foreign equity

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 49 (Forecasts); DLS Preferred Row 66 (Guarantees)

children.definition: Excluded from guarantee requirement (standard). Includes CFCs and FSHCOs. 65% stock pledge substitutes for direct guarantee. IRC Section 956 driven.
children.name: Foreign Subsidiaries
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 2 Item 3; Learning Material: 1) Subsidiaries of foreign borrower

GUAR_FOREIGN.label: Guarantors - Foreign Subsidiary Treatment
exactPhrases: no recourse to U.S. loan parties
no recourse to U.S. loan parties

children.definition: 2.5% of consolidated total assets individually.
children.name: Asset-Based Test

children.definition: Revenue test for immaterial subsidiary exclusion from guarantee requirements: subsidiaries contributing less than a specified percentage (typically 2.5%) of consolidated revenues individually may be excluded from the guarantor group.
children.name: Revenue-Based Test

children.definition: 2.5% of consolidated EBITDA individually. Most sophisticated test — correlates with earning power.
children.name: EBITDA-Based Test

children.definition: Cumulative ceiling on excluded immaterial subsidiaries. 5% aggregate of total assets standard. Prevents death-by-a-thousand-cuts exclusion.
children.name: Aggregate Immaterial Cap

children.definition: Subsidiaries below materiality threshold excluded. Individual: 2.5% total assets or revenue. Aggregate: 5% cap. Threshold must be defined objectively to prevent gaming.
children.name: Immaterial Subsidiaries
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 1 Item 2; Learning Material: Equity Interests in Unrestricted and Immaterial Subsidiaries

children.definition: Subsidiaries designated as unrestricted are excluded from guarantee requirements by definition. Subject to designation conditions (no EoD, investment capacity, pro forma compliance).
children.name: Unrestricted Subsidiaries

children.definition: Subsidiaries subject to regulatory capital requirements that preclude or limit guarantees (FINRA broker-dealers, insurance companies, regulated utilities). Regulatory exclusion.
children.name: Broker-Dealer / Regulated Subsidiaries

children.definition: Foreign Subsidiary Holding Companies treated as CFCs. Excluded from guarantee to avoid deemed repatriation of earnings of underlying foreign subs (IRC Section 956). 65% stock pledge instead.
children.name: FSHCO / CFC Holdcos

children.definition: Captive insurance companies excluded from guarantee requirements due to regulatory restrictions on encumbering insurance company assets. Standard carveout.
children.name: Captive Insurance Subsidiaries

children.definition: SPEs, not-for-profits, and other special-purpose subsidiaries excluded from guarantee. Contractual restrictions and organizational document limitations prevent guarantee.
children.name: Special Purpose Entities

children.definition: Subsidiaries with pre-existing contractual restrictions preventing guarantee (joint venture agreements, license agreements). 'Not in contemplation' qualifier limits abuse.
children.name: Contractually Prohibited Subsidiaries

children.definition: Subsidiaries where cost of providing guarantee exceeds benefit to lenders (agent determination). Used for immaterial foreign subs or subs in challenging jurisdictions.
children.name: Cost-Excessive Subsidiaries

children.definition: Categories of subsidiaries exempt from guarantee requirements. Each exclusion creates a structural gap in lender claim breadth. Aggregate excluded value must be monitored against collateral coverage.
children.name: Excluded Subsidiaries

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Guarantees limited to material subsidiaries only; excluded subsidiaries for immaterial subs; foreign subsidiaries excluded entirely
key_negotiation_axes: scope: all domestic vs material only
excluded_subsidiary_threshold: none vs revenue_based vs asset_based
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: All domestic subsidiaries (existing and future) guarantee on joint & several basis; Holdings guarantee; pledge 100% domestic equity, 65% first-tier foreign equity

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 66 (Guarantees); Review Template Row 39 (Collateral and Guarantors)

children.definition: Guarantee released upon sale or other disposition of all equity interests in the guarantor to a non-affiliate in a permitted transaction. Most common release trigger.
children.name: Disposition Release

children.definition: Guarantee released upon designation of guarantor as unrestricted subsidiary pursuant to the unrestricted subsidiary covenant. Subject to designation conditions.
children.name: Unrestricted Sub Designation Release

children.definition: Guarantee released when guarantor falls below materiality threshold and is reclassified as immaterial. Must satisfy aggregate immaterial cap. Tested at compliance certificate delivery.
children.name: Immaterial Sub Reclassification

children.definition: No automatic release solely because sub becomes non-wholly-owned. Release only if: (1) no longer sub, or (2) equity sale to non-affiliate for bona fide business purpose.
children.name: Chewy Blocker Present

children.definition: Release of non-wholly-owned sub guarantee requires bona fide business purpose (not solely to shed guarantee). Subjective test — borrower determines in good faith.
children.name: Bona Fide Purpose Test

children.definition: Release when subsidiary becomes non-wholly owned. PRIMARY LME TARGET: Chewy protection blocks automatic release solely because sub becomes non-wholly-owned.
children.name: Non-Wholly-Owned Release (Chewy Target)
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 3 Item 11; Review Template Row 40 (Collateral/Guarantor release – Chewy)

children.definition: Guarantee released when guarantor merged into borrower or another guarantor (no net reduction in guarantee coverage). Successor assumes all obligations.
children.name: Merger / Consolidation Release

children.definition: Circumstances under which a guarantor's obligation terminates. PC Term Comparison Chewy protection guidance: 'Typically include tighter formulation. Require investment capacity for FMV of released guarantor. Sale of equity to a non affiliate and/or bona fide business purpose (other than incurring the debt or lien). Avoid automatic release; require Agent action. If foreign Sub voluntarily guaranteed and seeks release add EOD stopper. Ask discuss whether to require that at the time of release that released sub cannot be guarantor of incremental/equivalent debt, ratio debt, incurred acquisition debt or refi debt.' LME Provision Language Protection #2 (Chewy) provides detailed drafting considerations and sample clause from MillerKnoll April 2025. KCT Category 3 item 11(a) flags: 'Guarantee that expressly releases a guarantor of its obligations to perform under the guarantee in the event of act(s) of war, hostilities, or escalation(s).'

GUAR_RELEASE_CHEWY.label: Guarantors - Chewy Release Protection
exactPhrases: ceases to be a wholly owned subsidiary
primarily for the purpose of release
shall be released as a Guarantor
ceases to be a wholly owned subsidiary
primarily for the purpose of release
shall be released as a Guarantor

children.name: Guarantee Release Conditions

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: Guarantees limited to material subsidiaries only; excluded subsidiaries for immaterial subs; foreign subsidiaries excluded entirely
key_negotiation_axes: scope: all domestic vs material only
excluded_subsidiary_threshold: none vs revenue_based vs asset_based
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: All domestic subsidiaries (existing and future) guarantee on joint & several basis; Holdings guarantee; pledge 100% domestic equity, 65% first-tier foreign equity

children.definition_source: PC Term Comparison Negative Covenants: Chewy section (6 conditions for tighter formulation); LME Provision Language Protection #2 (Chewy drafting considerations and common weaknesses); KCT Category 3 item 11(a) (force majeure release flag)

children.definition: Newly acquired subsidiaries that qualify as loan parties must execute joinder agreement within specified period after closing of acquisition. Standard 30-60 day deadline.
children.name: Acquisition Joinder
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 53 (Amendments to Acquisition Agreement)

children.definition: Newly formed subsidiaries must become guarantors promptly upon formation (typically within 30 days). Shorter deadline than acquisition joinder due to no third-party complexity.
children.name: Formation Joinder

children.definition: Time period to execute joinder agreement and deliver collateral documentation. Days after acquisition (30-60 typical) or days after formation (30 typical).
children.name: Joinder Deadline

children.definition: Time period to complete perfection of security interests in new guarantor's assets after joinder execution. Typically 30-60 days after joinder, with extensions for real property.
children.name: Perfection Deadline

children.definition: When pre-existing contractual restrictions on guarantees lapse (e.g., joint venture agreement expires), the subsidiary must become a guarantor within the standard joinder deadline.
children.name: Contractual Restriction Lapse

children.definition: Provisions allowing temporary delay of joinder for specific circumstances: regulatory approvals pending, local law opinions required, or material tax consequences identified.
children.name: Holdback Provisions

children.definition: Requirements for newly formed or acquired subsidiaries to join as guarantors. Timing, documentation, and holdback provisions govern the gap between acquisition and full guarantee coverage.

extraction_refs.difficulty_note: Aligned from ontology=medium vs playbook=very_hard (playbook authority for extraction complexity)

children.name: Guarantor Joinder Requirements

negotiation_spectrum.aggressive_position: 120d for first audit; going-concern for maturity/covenant ok; 60d for first 3 quarters; no monthlies; no forecasts or 90-120d; no lender calls or choose between MD&A/calls; reporting limited to Borrower + restricted subs
hot_button_items: (xvii) covenant to guarantee obligations and give security
key_negotiation_axes: audit_opinion_qualification: clean_only vs going_concern_maturity_ok vs going_concern_covenant_ok
lender_calls: quarterly vs annual vs not_required
negotiation_spectrum.preferred_position: 24 enumerated covenants: annual (90d, audited, clean opinion), quarterly (45d), monthly (30d), monthly forecasts, quarterly lender calls, MD&A, compliance certs, notices, tax/existence/property/insurance/ERISA/environmental, inspection rights, guarantee/security covenant, further assurances, IP, interest rate protection, FCPA/OFAC/Patriot Act

children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 66 (Guarantees); KCT Cat 3 Item 11; Review Template Row 39 (Collateral and Guarantors)

children.definition: Release triggered by the guarantor disposing of all or substantially all of its assets. Risk: guarantor can sell assets to a non-guarantor affiliate and shed guarantee obligations.
children.name: Disposition-Triggered Release

children.definition: Release triggered by the guarantor being designated as an unrestricted subsidiary. Risk: effectively removes guarantor from the credit group while retaining its assets outside the lender reach.
children.name: Unrestricted Subsidiary Designation Release

children.definition: Provision that expressly releases a guarantor of its obligations to perform under the guarantee upon the occurrence of an act by the guarantor itself (e.g., asset disposition, equity transfer, designation as an unrestricted subsidiary). KCT risk item: this creates a pathway for guarantors to engineer their own release, potentially leaving lenders with unsecured exposure. Must be cross-referenced with disposition covenant, unrestricted subsidiary designation, and J.Crew/Chewy blocker protections.

market_benchmarks.typical_triggers: disposition of guarantor, designation as unrestricted sub, merger into non-guarantor

children.name: Guarantee Release Upon Act of Guarantor
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 3 Item 11; Review Template Row 40 (Collateral/Guarantor release – Chewy)

definition: Entity coverage provisions defining which subsidiaries provide credit support. DLS Preferred row 78 affirmative covenants clause (xvii) requires a 'covenant to guarantee obligations and give security' (highlighted) and clause (xviii) covers 'creation or acquisitions of subsidiaries.' Review Template row 39: 'Collateral/guarantee scope should be "all assets" of U.S. loan parties with standard exceptions.' Learning Material section on Guarantees and Collateral discusses the standard formulation requiring all domestic restricted subsidiaries to guarantee. The guarantee perimeter directly determines the lender's claim base in distress and interacts with the Chewy protection (automatic release upon loss of wholly-owned status) and J.Crew/Pluralsight protections (asset leakage to non-guarantor entities).

market_benchmarks.bank_preferred: Holdings + all direct/indirect wholly-owned U.S. subs

name: Guarantees
definition_source: DLS Preferred row 78 clause (xvii) (highlighted: guarantee covenant); Review Template row 39 (all-assets scope for guarantors); Learning Material section on Guarantees and Collateral
